div.p: Say Something Anonymous Reporting System allows you to submit secure & anonymous safety concerns to help identify and intervene upon at-risk individuals BEFORE they hurt themselves or others.

a.title: Go to comments for Say Something

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: We are inviting our #WeAreDPS students and parents to create and submit videos to celebrate our teachers during the week.

a.title: Go to comments for Video Submissions | Teacher Appreciation Week

img.alt: Message from the Superintendent | Dr. Pascal Mubenga

a.span: Message from the Superintendent | Dr. Pascal Mubenga

div.p: Watch the latest update from our #WeAreDPS superintendent.

a.title: Go to comments for Message from the Superintendent | Dr. Pascal Mubenga

div.p: Check out our list of organizations that are providing meals throughout the week for children and their families.

a.title: Go to comments for DPS Community Resources for Meals

div.p: In conjunction with federal, state and local agencies, DPS is responding to the outbreak of COVID-19, the disease caused by 2019 novel coronavirus. For the latest, we have compiled a list of links to help you stay informed.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Information and Updates

img.alt: Parent/Guardian’s Guide to Grading and Graduation During COVID-19

a.span: Parent/Guardian’s Guide to Grading and Graduation During COVID-19

div.p: Following direction from the State Board of Education and the Department of Public Instruction, here is how Durham Public Schools is handling grading and graduation while our students are out of the classroom due to COVID-19.

a.title: Go to comments for Parent/Guardian’s Guide to Grading and Graduation During COVID-19

img.alt: DPS and Partners to Resume Feeding Children and Families During COVID-19

a.span: DPS and Partners to Resume Feeding Children and Families During COVID-19

div.p: A partnership between Durham Public Schools, Durham County Government, the Durham Public Schools Foundation and local nonprofits and restaurants organized as “Durham FEAST,” will launch a new meal support program for children and families starting on Thursday, April 16, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for DPS and Partners to Resume Feeding Children and Families During COVID-19
